foods.name: Salmon
foods.description: Salmon is a fatty fish rich in omega-3 fatty acids, which are beneficial for brain health and may contribute to stress reduction.

foods.name: Blueberries
foods.description: Blueberries are packed with antioxidants and vitamins, providing a refreshing and nutritious option that may help combat oxidative stress.

foods.name: Chamomile Tea
foods.description: Chamomile tea is known for its calming properties and is often consumed to promote relaxation and improve sleep.

foods.name: Quinoa
foods.description: Quinoa is a whole grain that contains complex carbohydrates and proteins, contributing to stable energy levels and a sense of fullness.

foods.name: Almonds
foods.description: Almonds are a good source of magnesium, which can have a calming effect on the nervous system. They also provide healthy fats.

foods.name: Avocado
foods.description: Avocado is rich in monounsaturated fats and potassium, contributing to heart health and providing a creamy, satisfying texture.

foods.name: Spinach
foods.description: Spinach is a leafy green vegetable rich in magnesium and other nutrients, supporting overall health and well-being.

foods.name: Dark Chocolate
foods.description: Dark chocolate contains flavonoids and compounds that may have mood-enhancing effects, but should be enjoyed in moderation.

foods.name: Oatmeal
foods.description: Oatmeal is a comforting and hearty breakfast option, rich in complex carbohydrates and fiber, providing a sustained release of energy.

foods.name: Yogurt with Berries
foods.description: Yogurt with berries combines the probiotics in yogurt with the antioxidants in berries, supporting both gut health and overall well-being.

foods.name: Green Tea
foods.description: Green tea contains L-theanine, an amino acid that has calming effects and can promote relaxation without drowsiness.

foods.name: Sweet Potatoes
foods.description: Sweet potatoes are rich in complex carbohydrates and fiber, providing a steady release of energy and a sense of satisfaction.

foods.name: Turkey
foods.description: Turkey is a good source of tryptophan, an amino acid that contributes to the production of serotonin, promoting a sense of calm and well-being.

foods.name: Honey
foods.description: Honey has natural sugars that can help regulate the release of serotonin, contributing to a stable mood and relaxation.

foods.name: Broccoli
foods.description: Broccoli is rich in vitamins and minerals, including magnesium, supporting a healthy nervous system and stress management.

foods.name: Cottage Cheese
foods.description: Cottage cheese is a good source of protein and also contains tryptophan, contributing to a sense of calm and relaxation.

foods.name: Chia Seed Pudding
foods.description: Chia seeds are rich in omega-3 fatty acids and can be combined with milk or yogurt to make a delicious and nutritious pudding.

foods.name: Bananas
foods.description: Bananas contain potassium and vitamin B6, which are important for the production of serotonin and can promote a calm mood.

foods.name: Walnuts
foods.description: Walnuts are rich in omega-3 fatty acids and antioxidants, supporting brain health and potentially reducing stress.

foods.name: Mango
foods.description: Mango is a tropical fruit rich in vitamins and antioxidants, providing a sweet and refreshing option with potential mood-boosting effects.

foods.name: Asparagus
foods.description: Asparagus is a nutrient-dense vegetable that contains folate, which plays a role in mood regulation and stress reduction.

foods.name: Pumpkin Seeds
foods.description: Pumpkin seeds are a good source of magnesium, helping to relax muscles and potentially contribute to stress relief.

foods.name: Chickpeas
foods.description: Chickpeas are a versatile legume rich in protein and fiber, providing a satisfying and nutrient-dense option for stress management.

foods.name: Lavender-infused Water
foods.description: Lavender has calming properties, and infusing water with lavender can create a soothing and hydrating beverage for relaxation.

foods.name: Brown Rice
foods.description: Brown rice is a whole grain that provides complex carbohydrates, promoting stable energy levels and a sense of fullness.

foods.name: Pomegranate
foods.description: Pomegranate is rich in antioxidants, particularly polyphenols, which may have anti-stress and anti-inflammatory effects.
